channel.title: CVE Feed for The Linux Foundation -- ONOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for The Linux Foundation -- ONOS

item.title: CVE-2019-1010252|2024-08-05T03:07:18.387Z -- the%20linux%20foundation -- onos
item.description: The Linux Foundation ONOS 2.0.0 and earlier is affected by: Poor Input-validation. The impact is: A network administrator (or attacker) can install unintended flow rules in the switch by mistake. The component is: applyFlowRules() and apply() functions in FlowRuleManager.java. The attack vector is: network management and connectivity.

item.title: CVE-2019-1010250|2024-08-05T03:07:18.519Z -- the%20linux%20foundation -- onos
item.description: The Linux Foundation ONOS 2.0.0 and earlier is affected by: Poor Input-validation. The impact is: A network administrator (or attacker) can install unintended flow rules in the switch by mistake. The component is: createFlow() and createFlows() functions in FlowWebResource.java (RESTful service). The attack vector is: network management and connectivity.

item.title: CVE-2019-1010249|2024-08-05T03:07:18.432Z -- the%20linux%20foundation -- onos
item.description: The Linux Foundation ONOS 2.0.0 and earlier is affected by: Integer Overflow. The impact is: A network administrator (or attacker) can install unintended flow rules in the switch by mistake. The component is: createFlow() and createFlows() functions in FlowWebResource.java (RESTful service). The attack vector is: network management and connectivity.

item.title: CVE-2019-1010234|2024-08-05T03:07:18.488Z -- the%20linux%20foundation -- onos
item.description: The Linux Foundation ONOS 1.15.0 and ealier is affected by: Improper Input Validation. The impact is: The attacker can remotely execute any commands by sending malicious http request to the controller. The component is: Method runJavaCompiler in YangLiveCompilerManager.java. The attack vector is: network connectivity.
